techmeme.title: Source: FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson, Assistant AG Gail Slater, and activist Mike Davis met Trump on April 8 to combat Meta's lobbying over the FTC antitrust case (Ben Smith/Semafor)
Q&A with Robinhood co-founder Vlad Tenev on becoming sole CEO, prediction markets, regulatory compliance, sports betting, the American dream, media, and more (Nilay Patel/The Verge)
Meta says it plans to train its AI models on public content, like posts and comments, and interactions that users have with its AI in the EU starting this week (Associated Press)
FTC v. Meta: in opening arguments, FTC lawyers accuse Meta of a "buy-or-bury strategy" to cement a social networking monopoly by buying Instagram and WhatsApp (New York Times)
Autonomous trucking startup Kodiak Robotics says it plans to go public in the US via blank-check company Ares Acquisition Corp II, valuing Kodiak at $2.5B (Deborah Sophia/Reuters)
